default.completer.ttlInSeconds.name: default.completer.ttlInSeconds
default.completer.ttlInSeconds.description: Time to live sql completer in seconds (-1 to update everytime, 0 to disable update)

default.completer.schemaFilters.name: default.completer.schemaFilters
default.completer.schemaFilters.description: Ð¡omma separated schema (schema = catalog = database) filters to get metadata for completions. Supports '%' symbol is equivalent to any set of characters. (ex. prod_v_%,public%,info)

default.precode.name: default.precode
default.precode.description: SQL which executes while opening connection

default.statementPrecode.name: default.statementPrecode
default.statementPrecode.description: Runs before each run of the paragraph, in the same connection

common.max_count.name: common.max_count
common.max_count.description: Max number of SQL result to display.

zeppelin.jdbc.auth.type.name: zeppelin.jdbc.auth.type
zeppelin.jdbc.auth.type.description: If auth type is needed, Example: KERBEROS

zeppelin.jdbc.auth.kerberos.proxy.enable.name: zeppelin.jdbc.auth.kerberos.proxy.enable
zeppelin.jdbc.auth.kerberos.proxy.enable.description: When auth type is Kerberos, enable/disable Kerberos proxy with the login user to get the connection. Default value is true.

zeppelin.jdbc.interpolation.name: zeppelin.jdbc.interpolation
zeppelin.jdbc.interpolation.description: Enable ZeppelinContext variable interpolation into paragraph text

zeppelin.jdbc.maxConnLifetime.name: zeppelin.jdbc.maxConnLifetime
zeppelin.jdbc.maxConnLifetime.description: Maximum of connection lifetime in milliseconds. A value of zero or less means the connection has an infinite lifetime.

zeppelin.jdbc.maxRows.name: zeppelin.jdbc.maxRows
zeppelin.jdbc.maxRows.description: Maximum number of rows fetched from the query.

zeppelin.jdbc.hive.engines.tag.enable.name: zeppelin.jdbc.hive.engines.tag.enable
zeppelin.jdbc.hive.engines.tag.enable.description: Set application tag for applications started by hive engines

markdown.parser.type.name: markdown.parser.type
markdown.parser.type.description: Markdown Parser Type. Available values: markdown4j, flexmark. Default = flexmark

HADOOP_CONF_DIR.name: HADOOP_CONF_DIR
HADOOP_CONF_DIR.description: Location of hadoop conf (core-site.xml, hdfs-site.xml and etc.)

flink.execution.mode.name: flink.execution.mode
flink.execution.mode.description: Execution mode, it could be local|remote|yarn

flink.execution.remote.host.name: flink.execution.remote.host
flink.execution.remote.host.description: Host name of running JobManager. Only used for remote mode

flink.execution.remote.port.name: flink.execution.remote.port
flink.execution.remote.port.description: Port of running JobManager. Only used for remote mode

local.number-taskmanager.name: local.number-taskmanager
local.number-taskmanager.description: Number of TaskManager in local mode

zeppelin.flink.uiWebUrl.name: zeppelin.flink.uiWebUrl
zeppelin.flink.uiWebUrl.description: User specified Flink JobManager url, it could be used in remote mode where Flink cluster is already started, or could be used as url template, e.g. https://knox-server:8443/gateway/cluster-topo/yarn/proxy/{{applicationId}}/ where {{applicationId}} would be replaced with yarn app id

zeppelin.flink.run.asLoginUser.name: zeppelin.flink.run.asLoginUser
zeppelin.flink.run.asLoginUser.description: Whether run flink job as the zeppelin login user, it is only applied when running flink job in hadoop yarn cluster and shiro is enabled

flink.udf.jars.name: flink.udf.jars
flink.udf.jars.description: Flink udf jars (comma separated), Zeppelin will register udfs in this jar for user automatically, these udf jars could be either local files or hdfs files if you have hadoop installed, the udf name is the class name

flink.udf.jars.packages.name: flink.udf.jars.packages
flink.udf.jars.packages.description: Packages (comma separated) that would be searched for the udf defined in `flink.udf.jars`

flink.execution.jars.name: flink.execution.jars
flink.execution.jars.description: Additional user jars (comma separated), these jars could be either local files or hdfs files if you have hadoop installed

flink.execution.packages.name: flink.execution.packages
flink.execution.packages.description: Additional user packages (comma separated), e.g. flink connector packages

zeppelin.flink.scala.color.name: zeppelin.flink.scala.color
zeppelin.flink.scala.color.description: Whether display scala shell output in colorful format

zeppelin.flink.scala.shell.tmp_dir.name: zeppelin.flink.scala.shell.tmp_dir
zeppelin.flink.scala.shell.tmp_dir.description: Temp folder for storing scala shell compiled jar

zeppelin.flink.hive.version.name: zeppelin.flink.hive.version
zeppelin.flink.hive.version.description: Hive version that you would like to connect

zeppelin.flink.module.enableHive.name: zeppelin.flink.module.enableHive
zeppelin.flink.module.enableHive.description: Whether enable hive module, hive udf take precedence over flink udf if hive module is enabled.

zeppelin.flink.maxResult.name: zeppelin.flink.maxResult
zeppelin.flink.maxResult.description: Max number of rows returned by sql interpreter.

flink.interpreter.close.shutdown_cluster.name: flink.interpreter.close.shutdown_cluster
flink.interpreter.close.shutdown_cluster.description: Whether shutdown flink cluster when close interpreter

zeppelin.interpreter.close.cancel_job.name: zeppelin.interpreter.close.cancel_job
zeppelin.interpreter.close.cancel_job.description: Whether cancel flink job when closing interpreter

zeppelin.flink.job.check_interval.name: zeppelin.flink.job.check_interval
zeppelin.flink.job.check_interval.description: Check interval (in milliseconds) to check flink job progress

zeppelin.flink.concurrentBatchSql.max.name: zeppelin.flink.concurrentBatchSql.max
zeppelin.flink.concurrentBatchSql.max.description: Max concurrent sql of Batch Sql

zeppelin.flink.concurrentStreamSql.max.name: zeppelin.flink.concurrentStreamSql.max
zeppelin.flink.concurrentStreamSql.max.description: Max concurrent sql of Stream Sql
